data.q: What is the prototype chain in JavaScript used for?
data.e: The prototype chain allows property and method lookups to traverse up linked objects.

data.q: Which keyword is used to define a class in modern JavaScript?
data.e: The class keyword was introduced in ES6 to define classes more cleanly.

data.q: What does the 'new' keyword do in JavaScript?
o: Instantiates an object from a constructor function or class
data.e: The new keyword creates an instance of an object using a constructor function or class.

data.q: Which method is automatically called when creating a new instance of a class?
data.e: The constructor() method is executed when a new instance of a class is created.

data.q: How is inheritance implemented in ES6 classes?
data.e: The extends keyword allows one class to inherit from another in ES6.

data.q: What does 'this' refer to inside a class method?
o: The current instance of the class
data.e: Inside a class method, 'this' refers to the current instance of the class.

data.q: Which feature allows defining methods that belong to the class itself rather than its instances?
data.e: Static methods are defined with the static keyword and belong to the class itself.
